data.text: Mostly intuitive banking/credit card app. Easy to navigate. I absolutely HATE that they won't add in a running balance by transaction. Literally would be a 5* app if they added it in. Typical bank. Credit journey could be more informative; my number regularly fluctuates by 20-30 points but the explanations are always the same, but having the info on hand is good. Offers are ok. Haven't used the travel/points redemption area of the app yet.

Constantly crashes. Trying to make a payment is extremely frustrating. I can log in, get to the payment screen then the screen disappears. I then have to re-log in and try again and again and again. Absolutely HATE this app. Needs a LOT of work. Can't wait to pay this card off so I can cancel it and never have to deal with this garbage app again .

I do love the apps features, but it runs terribly slow and constantly crashes or freezes my phone during the login process. my phone can handle all the games I install, even really resource heavy ones so I am not sure why it's struggling to load so much but it's been this way the whole time I've had it, it's been years. I still love the features and how easy it makes things when it works but it's always a gamble if I'll even be able to log in without my phone freezing.

Want random, normal purchases to be flagged as fraudulent?? Download the Chase App! Hoping to miss out on hard-to-get releases because of dogshit fraud detection?? Chase Bank will mess that up for you too! Just check Google and you'll see that this has been an ongoing problem for Chase customers for 5+ years. Seems no one at Chase is smart enough to fix it! The best solution is closing your accounts - which I highly recommend.

Seriously regretting getting chase for the rewards points. The booking site is completely archaic. Very difficult to look through hotels, and absolutely no options to put in how much you would like to spend either above your points or if you would like to view hotels only with in your point range. The map refreshes anytime you move it so that you lose track of what it was you were looking at. And it list hotels aren't even available. Over all super frustrating.

You Android app needs a lot of work, even on the highest end devices. The navigation bar icons overlap each other. The app is also very slow. This is the case on the iPhone app. The Ultimate Rewards pages are extremely slow, and they time out multiple times per sessions. I am tempted to transfer my points out of Chase just so I don't have to use the Chase portal. This poor experience is consistent across platforms.

It depends on how much you utilize the app. The payment feature works well. I love that I can lock and unlock card for use. This was a lifesaver when I was in Europe and somebody stole my card 4 days into a 5-week trip. However, if you use the site to gain Travel Reward points and book travel it is not good. It's buggy, it stalls out, it lags. There are constant issues loading Pages sometimes it can be hard to find your trips and all the details that you might need.

Most of the features on the app are solid, and fairly straightforward to use. Love Chase credit cards too, but I can't give more than two stars for one huge reason: you CANNOT edit/cancel recurring transfers. On the app OR the website. How asinine is that?? Whoever is in charge of app/web development is failing miserably, this is such a basic and necessary feature... Get it together Chase!

The banking side of the app is fine, hence the 3 stars. However, the Credit Journey side of the app is frustratingly incorrect. I understand small discrepancies in the app's calculated credit vs. the real bureau's (maybe around 10 points), but my score was off by 41 points! That's a major discrepancy that should be addressed. How can anyone take Chase seriously when they are bloating credit scores by over 40 points?

The credit card information is so variable. I've had a charge show up in pending one day, disappear the next, past the third. It's frustrating trying to figure out the balance in order to pay it in full. I've relied on the amount to have a lost charge show up and end up with a balance. Is simple math. You should be able to see everything and calculate additions and subtractions. Not rocket science.

Like most credit card apps and statements, it's often unclear what your actual balance is. The total may or may not include the next autopayment, and some but not all pending transactions. It would be so much easier to have independent totals for each billing cycle, or better yet, have the autopayment and billing cycle dates be the same. Also, it's infuriating that an Amazon credit card is not even able to map Amazon charges to Amazon orders... It's like Amazon and Chase don't even talk.

App appears disorganized, mainly using the bill pay feature. Counter intuitive when looking for specific information or adding or changing payees. PC website works much better. Exsamples; Too many steps and difficult to find, change, or add payee info. Payee page is cluddered, leaving only a small space to navigate payees. The scan QR, Zelle, and recently used features all cover the screen. Those bars need to be collapsible, swiped away, or located on a separate page.

The app is good, I can Zell people through it, but the constant security reminders are a little annoying, also you can send money to people and add notes, but you can't see the notes in your account which defeats the purpose.. and you can screenshot so you won't know what thr note is. App is good to also transfer money through accounts. Pay your credit cards with Chase in the app, check your account without logging in and more. Overall a great app! üëç

Slow and clunky. Attempting to take a picture for mobile deposit causes the screen to go back and phone to lock up. Have to pull the battery on the phone to shut it off. Phone is maybe a year old. They need to hire someone to record the app that understands how to code efficiently. Very destructive app. Update: the app can't figure out how to take a picture a check. It says use a dark black while using a dark background, says get closer when it's perfect, says move away when too close, broken!!

Super annoying. Can't do most things via the app and am forced to call in. Calling in is the worst. It always takes so long to do anything, and no matter what it is. They also always end up telling me I can do things on the app. No I can't. Right now for example. I need to dispute a transaction and it's promoting me to once again call in. The app also wouldn't accept checks saying I had previously deposited them which was impossible, I just received them. Application is lagging and annoying.

Mostly good. But in the interest of giving feedback, I have some notes. The menus for bill pay and Zelle should be consolidated, but as it stands, navigating outgoing payments and transfers are awkwardly compartmentalized. Also, the red-colored UI cue for a nearly due or overdue payment sometimes appears after I have already sent payment. It's counter Intuitive and annoying. I hope they fix it.

The app is a bit over cluttered and full ads for other Chase services. But it does get the basic job done I guess. The biggest disappointment in the app though is that it doesn't have a widget to show your recent account transaction history. I shouldn't have to log into the just to see where the money in my account is going, at a glance. I would like to see that information on my Android home screen / desktop. So that I can quickly catch any strange transactions.

Been a Chase CC customer since 2013. The app is decent, but I think there should be more stats available, especially about cash back. I could've swore they had a more available breakdown before. My BIGGEST issue is that 99% of the time I go to pay using a custom amount the keyboard won't pop up and then it often freezes. I'm just trying to pay my bill...

Chase has some great options for small businesses accessible through the app, like Zelle. The security of this app is lacking though. For example, Chase doesn't seem to do MFA, and if it does, it's just via a phone number. Some fintech apps have a way to be secured by biometrics (fingerprints) AND a pin or device-specific password. I can't type in my full, secure account-password each time, so I just unlock by fingerprint. That is not secure.

I would like to give no star as a business client. App has bugs when sending secure messages. Can't upload PDFs only photos I need to take while using the app. Otherwise the app would crash. The Chase business website is also not properly working. You can at least upload a PDF document but when I want to write a text message, it doesn't let me. And without a text message your can't send it.

To many ads, every time you start the app it ask if you want to start your home buying journey, if you want to make split payments or look what's new that you have to click through. Every time I want to us this app I get pop ups. The dash board even has ads for chase products. There is no way to customize your dash board, chase only cares about advertising products and services that I don't need or want.

The session timeout is way too short, I cannot effectively browse the travel section while coordinating with other apps without it logging me out and losing all my progress. I am unable to screenshot the application, which I get is a security measure but I should have the ability to re-enable it (temporarily?) in order to accomplish my needs. Otherwise it's a perfectly fine banking app.

Best banking app out there. Love it. Very easy to navigate and also it displays a lot of information needed for any customer about various products. App itself is good enough than visiting banking in person. Guys, can you add back auto refresh or implement credit card refresh on payment, because I have to sign out of app and then login in to see credit card limit updated after payment. This happens on my sapphire reserve card, don't think this is card specific.

This app was pretty good. Still is, however there used to be a section on the main page with a "activity since last statement balance". Now it's buried in the "see transactions" section. This feature is more useful to me then having my total balance show which includes last months statement balance. I just think it's better to see a running total for the month. Is there any way to get this back?

Scammers. Cost for flights are more than double through Chase. Not even worth it lol. Used the same dates and airports on both Google and Chase. On Google, the price was $281, and through Chase, was $638. For the same airline, and had the exact same times. No way. Where's the FTC lol. So I guess the trick is to make you feel like you're getting a deal by racking up points by buying more stuff and then inflate the price. Very unethical. It should be illegal to do that.

I'm constantly getting "We are unable to connect to Chase temporarily please try again later. Thank you for your patience." When I called Chase Support I get just Uninstall the APP & Reinstall!!! Well I've done that & also tried it on both Android & iPhone!! I've been only connected with the APP once or twice!! What a waste of time!!

I just got a Southwest chase card. When I tried to setup my app it had my brother's information on there and wouldn't let me change it. Calling in didn't do any good. After getting that resolved I tried to use my card a couple times but it didn't go through. After calling customer service, they said they needed to finish verifying my account by calling but I never received a call. Then they say I need to go into chase bank. I've never had any issues with Discover or capital one. Poor service

I would say that overall, it's an okay app. I can look at my accounts and pay things as needed. However, the constant restriction to access or issues logging in is very frustrating. There is also no warning about updates either, which means that my account isn't up to date and so I don't even know my current balance which is frustrating and upon trying to login online it says my info is incorrect and won't let me login even tho I just used the same info to login on the app

Quick access to accounts works great. Zelle works great. Ultimate rewards to book travel is a nightmare, won't load, takes forever, have to do that from the internet instead of app. Needs to be improved. Don't like the functionality of adding offers (the add button opens up the offer almost as a whole page so makes it challenging to add multiple offers quickly). The previous version was more user friendly.

I hate leaving bad reviews, and the app is great, but i am soooo sick of it restarting my phone half the time when i open it. Its distressing that i loose all notifications from the sudden phone restart, and sometimes it freezes in restart for a few minutes. And then I STILL need to access the app to check my account! I updated the app recently in hopes that it would stop restarting my phone, but here we are again. What do i do?? (Other then get rid of the app)

Update takes forever to upload. Still can't access nor upload the updated version. I liked what I already have. Also, with auto update on, it doesn't auto update. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling , and it's still taking forever. This newest update is worthless and irritating and doesn't work to access. Needs to go back to the previous version that was working just fine.

It was great until it was updated. Now, it never thinks it's connected to service, causing me to have to hit authorize on a transaction multiple times before it will even process it. That is, of course, if I can even log into the app because it will say multiple times that something went wrong when trying to open. Same connect to service issue when trying to check transaction history. This greatly impacts running a busy! I don't know what you did cause it worked fine before. Fix it NOW!!!

I love this app and have been with banking with chase forever. But lately there's been a lot of issues connecting to my payout accounts and updating my transactions as I use my card... I've had the same available balance all day and used my card twice. It did this yesterday too and updated over night.. but I'm in a very bad financial spot right now where every penny counts and not being able to keep track and see my bank statements has been very inconvenient..

They like to rearrange your payments, charge unnecessary fees, and have recently started taking more than a week to deposit checks. And when my credit card overcharged my intentionally small limit, they informed the credit bureaus the same day and I didn't find out until later. Dropped my credit score 38 points. You have to PAY for them to decline a charge that goes over limit. The AI chat option is next to useless. If this wasn't standard at every US bank, I would leave.

This app is horrible! I tried using the app to initiate a balance transfer. Absolutely useless app! I searched the entire app, yet there was nothing to be found regarding balance transfers! Funny, because I can easily do balance transfers on their website. Clearly, the Chase app is totally useless when it comes to doing your banking with Chase. Apparently, banking with Chase only works on their website. So why does Chase have an app at all, considering how useless it is compared to the website?

Can't see what the individual line items are. When you look at transactions, there is no way to click on an individual item to see what it actually is - only the first bit shows up. So "Returned item for for an unpaid..." is not helpful because I can't see WHAT was unpaid. Other than that the app is fine. It's a standard banking app. Very useful.

This app says it supports Android 7 and up, but refuses to install to an Android 10 Go Edition device, and says it is "unsupported." Chase has also dropped support for check depositing through their website, which is a huge step backwards. Since their app won't work on a device I just bought a month ago (May 2021), I'm completely unable to deposit a check without physically going to a branch office. Of course, a lot of branches have been closed, because "mobile banking is so convenient." What's the deal Chase, is it suddenly 1997 again?

Decent app, the navigation is a bit wonky at times. I wish hitting 'back' could take you back to home screen rather just "sign out and exit app". Also, would be nice to have a Snapshot screen to see a few basic details (balance, payment date/amount, recent transactions) without having to fully login. Would also be really nice to have app reflect what the new balance will be after the payment like my other cards' apps do.

App gets worse by the day!! Most days it doesn't even open!! TERRIBLE!! Often gets stuck 'loading' and you can't even escape from that - it just freezes forever! Initial review- Cannot do screen prints on my personal account. This is one of the most frustrating aspects of the Chase app!! It's my personal account and I need to be able to do screen prints of point in time data and other transactions. Hate this about this app!! It also logs you out every couple of minutes literally- very annoying!!

It's okay. A couple of things that I don't like... can't read the full description of the transactions also, can't click on the transactions to see more of the description. The application is always updating & now doesn't let me take screenshots of my own transactions. Due to some security protection. The app just gets worse and worse everytime it updates.

Unfortunately, the notification system is badly broken. The app either gives me NO notifications or TWO copies of every notification. The app does NOT notify me when a merchant cancels a transaction or provides a refund. But the app gives me TWO notifications for every charge that's pending. The app only notifies me of charges over $1--not over $0. Why? The app does NOT notify me when a charge has been modified like when I add a gratuity at a restaurant. One would think this is a critical component of any security notification system. This makes the notification system worthless because it's not an accurate representation of my statement.  Logging in as another user breaks the already-broken notifications so that I have to log in to my account again and disable and enable all of the notifications to get them even half-working again. The app must be able to handle two users (e.g., a couple with their own Chase credit cards). Also, Chase's two-factor authentication system still uses the hacked SMS system instead of one-time passwords. This has become so tedious and time-consuming that I'm considering canceling my credit card and moving to a new bank.

I would say out of all the bankings apps I've used with big banks Chase by far has the most easy to use and user friendly interface out there. My only drawback is the constant force closing and bugginess of the app. I usually have to close the app at least once and usually get it to work on the second attempt. I've had three different phones and all have had the same issues with the app.

It defaults to business. It doesn't matter how many times you select other accounts (mortgage, credit card, other accounts) it returns to business checking. When I try to pay a bill, the app goes to "what is this payment for?", it will not allow you to move forward to "schedule". It stays on the what's this payment for screen. Very frustrating.

After last update, I can't turn back on fingerprint access. It says "We are temporarily unable to connect with Chase. Please try again later." Tried on both wifi and cellular without any difference. Apparently "temporarily" means weeks not hours. It makes a lackluster app that gets in the way more than it helps that much worse when I can't easily access my accounts. If you're looking for a bank and considering Chase, keep looking. The poor digital experience is universal across platforms.

This app worked fine for me up until the last update. It won't even open for me. At first I thought it was an issue with phone storage. But I've deleted many apps and photos... and it still doesn't work. Wish you could go back and undo this update bc it look like other people have been having issues too. I just wanna quickly check my balance/deposit checks from my phone!

I love the Chase Mobile App! It is VERY easy to use, & it's quite simple to navigate your way through it. Since I am able to deposit checks into my account with this app, I RARELY have to go to the bank, & I RARELY have to call Customer Service. I think it's wonderful!! The ONLY problem that I have had recently is, that, when I get a notification from Chase, the alert(s)/notification(s) never go away anymore! It acts as if I had NOT checked these things out ü§î?

This is the slowest app I have, my Walmart app works way better than this. The fingerprint sign in doesn't work half the time and when you set up the fingerprint sign in it doesn't let you know it is successful. They keep adding more features to the app and can't even get right what they have. Now that was a few months ago and it has gotten a lot better. Thanks

Every mandatory update creates more frustration. I have two accounts with them so when I changed the username to type in my other one the app wants to delete the previous one. I don't see an option to save the username. The app caused me to logout and lock my account. I called to reset and get a verification code. Some autocall was going to give me a verification code instead of just sending a text. The system didn't give me more than 20 seconds to find a pen before it hung up on me.

The app is okay. You can make payments through the app. Has a lot of improvements to make though. Fingerprint recognition fails often and makes you sign in instead. Chase advertises shop with chase and at the time of checkout it doesn't allow you to pay... waste of time. Also point redemption is poor as when you choose to buy something on chase the transaction does not go through and the choice of using all or none of your points is no longer available, you can no longer do that which is ridiculous! What if I don't want to spend my points yet?

WHO'S PROGRAMMING THESE UPDATES?! This app is atrocious! Half the time when I try to log into my account, it times out. Not from a bad connection (I have 5G wifi) but because it takes forever to load. Then when you DO finally log in, navigating it is just awful. There is no intuitive structure to any of it. Go back to the old version. The GOOD one!

Chase turned off my autopayments; I check everyday to make sure the automatic payments for credit card was turned on. It has been on since I got the credit card. Tried to use it today and was unable to due to bill not being paid. Checked automatic payments and it was turned off. I did not turn them off. Now my bill has extra late fees and my credit score has been negatively affected. Thanks Chase.

This is literally the slowest app I have on any device. It takes forever for this app to acknowledge touches, and it won't show me both my personal and business accounts on the same screen, like the website does. Using the browser is easier and better than using this app. Update: It's still slow and bouncing back-and-forth between business and personal accounts is still a pain - but the mobile deposit feature is awesome!

Like a few others have posted here, the app crashes on every attempt to login. I upgraded to Android 10 last month, and ever since then I can't login to the app. I have uninstalled and reinstalled more than 10 times over the last month, and it still won't work. I've sent over 50 app crash reports. Reached out to support, but get no help. FIX YOUR APP CHASE!!!

This is the slowest, worst performing app on my phone. It takes a minute to load any screen, and I'm lucky if it doesn't crash first. No app, let alone from a company as large as Chase, should perform this poorly. They keep trying to add features when they should be focusing on improving the core experience. Maybe Chase should take a look at the Capitol one app for some inspiration.

Not sure what happened. After last update, the app kept freezes up. I have try to log out and log back in several time for it to work. Or if I look at one account then I am not able to click to get to another account, it just freezes. Basically this app is useless now, just uninstalled. Until problem is fix, will not be using it anymore.

lately this app has been stalling, unable to load or close. In addition, the preview screen stops working when the setting is selected. This will be my 2nd time uninstalling & reinstalling. I hope that future updates improve the app & not make it unstable. It's getting quite frustrating as I had been enjoying it problem-free for quite some time.

I love being able to access my banking information so easily, but the app itself has been really glitchy lately - I repeatedly get an "unavailable" message when I try to log in, and it keeps "losing" my fingerprint login information so I have to keep resetting it. Used to be better, but whatever the latest update is (either on the Chase app or the Android system end of things) has caused problems.

Fun but challenging game. Basically the goal is to collect coins and never let it drop below 0. You have to play for a long time to even try and get enough coins for food and general supplies so you don't die. The whole time too you have several kinds of villains trying to take your coins. The "bills" are pretty nasty and can wipe you out in one shot but they are nothing like the "surprise car repair" goblins! It's pretty addictive...almost like you're not allowed to stop playing!

This was a great app, until they added some sort of pop up, as soon as you open the app, a few months ago. This wouldn't be so bad, if the pop up screen didn't freeze on a blank screen, and lock you on that screen until you close and reopen the app. The back button stops responding, so I have to close the app completely. It makes just checking my balance or budget so tedious, as I have to open the app, log in, close the app, open the app again, log in again, only then I can I get anything done.

I've been using this app for years. It's definitely improving with time. Except now it's completely broken. I used the app last night with no issues. This morning it won't respond to fingerprints, takes minutes to recognize it needs to activate the phone keyboard when you want to type in your password, and force closes (crashes) when you tap submit. I'm on Android 9 with a Samsung S9+. It was updated 10 hours ago according to my apps list and I guess I join the rest waiting for Chase to fix it.

Brain dead app not synced with website! When I set up my acct online they had an old email and phone I no longer have access to (have no idea where they got that) and wanted to send a verification code. So I had to call customer service. Once signed in, I updated my info. Yet this stupid app is still showing the outdated info, so I can't use it. Thanks for wasting my time!

The app is very easy to navigate. My biggest complaint is it often takes multiple attempts to deposit a check. Often you have to sign out and sign back in again. Not sure why this is so problematic.  Update May 21 2019 App will launch, but wont't log-in. Keep getting the message We are temporarily unable to connect to Chase. I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app and the problems persist.   I'm on the verge of permanently uninstalling. This log-in issue has been going on for a few weeks now.

Least convenient banking app I have ever used. Uninstalling and closing Chase accounts. Always has been a hassle, but more convenient than switching banks. Well, the last update now makes it so my current phone doesn't support the app, so I can't even open it and use it. I have to buy a new phone, use my work desktop, or go to a branch. Hard pass. My local podunk credit union has a better app.

I have had a chase account for 12 years. I have been using the app since it came out. Typically, I have never had any problems. I can move my money in my accounts around with ease. They show me where all my expenses are going. Overall, the app has just been getting better over the years. Recently, I have been running into a huge glitch when depositing my check. Everytime you press front to capture a picture of the check the app completely freezes. I hope they are able to get this fixed soon.

if I could give negative stars I would! the constant "upgrades" and required password changes make it a horrible experience each time I want to pay the bill. Do yourself a favor and go with a different bank for your credit card. Chase has been the worst for the past 12 years. They ran the computer program the same way before apps and they have never made a positive change. now I have to choose between deleting apps I use or checking and paying my credit card balance.

It's on ok app at it's core, but it has a lot of bugs. If you try an click on an account, it'll either freeze, or sign you out. It also completely signs you out from time to time for absolutely no reason. When this happens, you're not allowed to log back in until you uninstall and reinstall the app. There are more bugs, but these are the major ones.

I hate the updated version of this app. Every time that I try to expand something, it opens up to nothing but a blank page. And when I try to view the self-help topics on why this is happening, yep... just another blank page. I want info on setting up a savings account... Blank page. I need to read my alerts... Blank page. And don't even get me started on whatever is going on with my transactions and balances because it's always a huge mess and nothing is ever posted correctly anymore... SMH

Up until recently the app has worked well. Not sure what happened with the support of the app but it has completely fallen apart. As other users have stated the functions within the app outside of the main screen don't work. If you select anything the app either freezes or takes you to blank white page. Considering Chase is one of the largest banking institutions in the world I find it both inept and unprofessional for the company to have such a dysfunctional interface.

slowest app on the planet - what happened??? Used to be quick and easy. Now a black screen comes up when you ask it to switch tasks. And super slow!!! At first i thought i had done something wrong and my phone shut off. Nope. Just black screen. What used to take 10 minutes to do paying bills takes more like 35. depisiting a check takes 10 minutes. checking a balance takes several minutes. whatever they did was not good. I used to love this app. No longer.

For the longest, this app was user friendly, it allowed me access to my account easily, I could deposit checks without going to the bank, etc. It was great. But the last two weeks, i cannot get past the log in screen and Chase customer service is unhelpful. I input my login info, the app tells me I need a vertical code (which I request), after inputting the verification code and password, it takes me directly back to the log in screen. When I explained this to Chase (multiple times) all I was told was that I had already logged in and the app was working fine because no one had called in problems. I have uninstalled/reinstalled the app, I have restarted my phone, I've cleared the cache, I've even factory reset my phone and each time, I can access the app for a bit before it shuts down.

Too many updates back to back...!! Also, why in the world does the screen completely change to a black screen whenever I want to go to a different section on my account? It doesn't make any sense what so ever! The last time I updated the app the black screen has been appearing on the app. It looks like the app has closed up or something. It's extremely confusing and frustrating to wait until you see any of your accounts reappear. The first time this happened I thought the app stopped. Fix it.

Too many updates, too often. After installing latest update it takes way to long for sign in and to move from one screen to the next. The blue circle just keeps spinning, It is inconvenient to constantly have to log in and out to utilize the app. This is not banking made easy. As of 6/3 I have had to uninstall this app and re install multiple times and still can't use because it closes on its own. What's the point of the updates if the issues just continously get worst.

The app is actually the reason why I am in the process of closing my chase accounts. It never works, always says there is no internet connection on my phone even though everything else is working. After uninstalling and reinstalling for months I am over it. cant believe a large corporation in 2019 cant have an app that works. pathetic! Dont bother downloading, it will just cause frustration.

This app is ALWAYS crashing and so many features never work. It glitches out every time I try to set up my fingerscan login. More often than not the app says "something went wrong, please try again later" when I try to make a payment of even log in. I am honestly going to leave Chase bank when I combine my finances once I'm married because I have constant issues with the app. It's such a bummer because when it works, it's a great app! But the amount of times it glitches is not worth it.

Something has gone wrong with this app like several others I'm not able to use it. Each time I try it refuses to let me in. Constantly telling me to UPDATE! I've tried everything but I see some giving good reviews so what is the problem Chase??? I've used the app for almost a year now but lately it's crazy and I can't even use it! Now I can't even re-install it! Please take the necessary steps to solve this problem. I can't pay you or check for discrepancies and it's been weeks since it's worked

UPDATE: The previous mentioned instability was due to being used on an old android tablet. Works perfect on newer current version tablet. Orig Review: When trying to log on the screen will often simply 'flutter' and go blank, multiple login attempts need to be made just to use the app, and it sometimes even when successfully logged in it just dies and goes to a blank screen. On the plus side, when it works I love the ability to pay ahead for pending charges. Most other cards don't allow that.

Pretty good so far. Had my accounts closed and locked because of an error on the bank's behalf and had to open new checking and savings accounts; went to the branch and they cashed me out. Definitely do not recommend opening your account online because of that. Otherwise, everything functions well, has reasonable security measures, a smooth interface, and provides ease of use as well as clear and accessible features. Some complicated areas, but hey, we're adults. We can figure it out.

95% of the time the app does not work as intended. I use it for trading and I have suffered significant market time losses due to the app failing to work. When you log into the app and you want to view or place trade, the app goes into white screen and unable to present any information. This has happened not once or twice but numerous times. The website version doesn't have this complained-about issue. Chase, this app is completely disappointing and causing harm in unintended ways.

Please fix the app!!! A lot of the menus and settings open to a blank white screen and don't ever load. I also get random alert flags, but find there's no unread alert. I can't "give feedback" in the app, I can't "dispute charges" in the app so I had to call in, I can't set security alerts... come on, please fix the app. This is now becoming redundant to even have the app if I have to constantly go to the web page to make the changes I want...

Not allow to report fraud and dispute scam charge in the app. Need to call customer service who could not do anything either. Have to lock the card, take the losses, and give up the 16 years old account. Update: two months after canceling the old card plus locking, it still got billed by an accidental app purchase. So technically there's no such thing called card canceling for Chase. Be aware!

This app never works on my android. Usually I get a little farther than the log on screen before it freezes so hard I have to restart my phone, but today it wouldn't even load the log on page. Use the full chase site if you have to. This app is now, and always has been absolute non-functional trash.

Nothing's more annoying than seeing ads, but in a bank app, that's frustrating. As I'm scrolling through my credit statement, between each transaction is a little card "see rewards", " refer a friend", "see benefits", "see to brand offer", etc... really. You've already had those options for click somewhere else and I didn't want to, why do you think it'd be better to bring them front and center in my transaction logs is going to make me click on them. Stupid design

Outdated, not user friendly, slow and crashes, some features don't work and they refuse to fix for years, very difficult to navigate, App will force you to the web version for all sorts of things and you have to re log into account, chat help tool is literally useless and will just end up giving you a customer support number to call after wasting 15-20 min of your time, can not print tax document statements for investment accounts. But if you want new services sold to you regularly, it's for you

Disjointed and unorganized sections. I downloaded the app in order to quickly check my checking account. I shouldn't have to log in online to see my account, it makes me wonder why there's an app in the first place, looks like it's only good for checking credit your score and opening an account versus viewing the account.

Android phone. Horrible experience. Like so many other reviews are saying, the app does not let you pay the credit card bill. It gets stuck on "loading" and never actually loads the page. Then, you can't do anything else in the app without closing and re-logging in.

Can you please fix the issue that app can't return to the main page from ACH payment services window. Back button in the upper left corner do nothing except click sound... more than half a year has to close app without signing out after ACH payment and logging again. Thanks.

It really is a great app, it has so much on there for credit score, wealth ü§ë management (for those of us that want to versify our investments) Chase is part of JP Morgan, so we've got credibility!!! All in all it's the best banking App I've had. I would. Recommend it with much enthusiasm.

Android app is very frustrating. Cant even view profile settings or privacy settings because it's always giving a "This part is not working right now!" error. It's also very cluttery and slow. Do Better

Chase is fine by me. It let me transfer some to my CashApp debit card to keep my bank debit card safe and use it for food purchases. Because of skimmers who stole my monies. Ugh. And I'm happy that Chase became very aggressive and got my monies back. I would love to use my debit card but not its not safe at gas pump, atm, or kiosk. So have to use Cashapp card for safety. Cashapp let me add and remove my debit card for extra safety. :-) It also lemme lock it and unlock it anytime if I use it.
Mostly fine, but it absolutely needs a running balance next to transactions. Impossible to verify if I'm being charged accurately without exporting all transactions. Docking 4 stars for that.

Chase saved my life once, they gave me 300$ for starting a checking account with them when I was broke. Even after joining the military and having the option to switching to a more convenient bank I remembered chase saved me from being homeless at the time. I know it's not much money but I'll never forget it. Thank you for a weeks worth of pay (at the time) I remember what you have done for me and I have payed it forward 10x over.

Design needs updating. I would like to be notified of every transaction but they don't have that feature on the app or the ability to separate incoming funds vs deduction. You can't search for a transaction specifically, like being able to type "h&m" for example would be helpful. Credit score is different than the real score at times. Also recently app has been glitchy or force closing.

I love the app! It's banking made easy.. and I LOVE the fact that I can check on my credit score whenever I want. It motivates me to aim for a higher score. It's like a game to me! And it lets u set a goal and has a variety of ways for you to achieve it. Sending Zelle is easy, and transferring funds to pay bills is a breeze

I have had to uninstall and reload the app 3 times. I have a Motorola and after the first log in or maybe it's because I try to save my password ü§î something I am testing this time the whole app blanks out white and I can't do anything at all once it does that I have to uninstall. Very frustrating. The 2 times I have been able to see it is good. Easy to understand and find things out does take extra effort to get some info compared to my other banking apps. I hope the white screen can be fixed.

This problem might be because I am using an outdated tablet (Galaxy tab s6) but the see all transaction section of the app repeats transactions. It looks like the app is glitching from what I could tell. The good thing is that it does not take any additional money out of my account but it did almost trick me when I was doing my monthly audit for th month of january

Updated this app and it is showing SO MANY nuisance messages and popups each time I log in. I DO NOT want any suggestions, if I need I for action or advice I will seek it. What a horribly annoying and intrusive way to push their unwanted services !!! Update 3/16 The nuisance offers don't stop. Time to say bye bye to 22 year old account and start using other bank. Chase app has absolutely gone to the dogs

it's a functional app and it works well. I'm on pixel 8 pro and the bottom of the UI inside the app is all messed up, text overlapping from section to section. It looks really bad for a company with such a large user base. not sure if anyone reported this before.

Reliable and allows most banking actions simply and easily. Took one star away for glaring issue. Viewing a transaction list under See All Transactions for an account, the thick blue lines should be shifted. They appear to separate the transactions by date and activity, but this is not the case. Each date belongs to the next transaction BELOW the line rather than the same transaction between the blue lines. This is not very intuitive and should be fixed to eliminate confusion.

I'm very disappointed in Chase/Sapphire. I've had a Chase credit card for years & a couple days ago I got a notification when I logged in to my account that I was pre-approved for a Sapphire credit card. I wasn't looking to get another credit card but I thought to myself, "Hey, it'll be good to have as a back up card." I convinced myself & clicked on the pre-approval notification only to find out I WAS NOT APPROVED." To anyone considering getting a Chase/Sapphire card beware, they are deceitful.

I left my old bank of 10+ yrs because they merged with bmo hairris and i seriously didn't like bmo harris mobile app for a plethora of reasons but i am starting to think i shouldn't have left. Not once of having that account had i ever had fruad charges but i sure did for the first time with Chase. That alone wouldn't be a reason cause support was great!! My issue is once i got my debit replacement, it was closed the NEXT DAY!!??? I am now going to be late on bills, we'll see on this 3rd card
